intro: Petrorhagia saxifraga f. bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored rock rose, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive bicolor flowers, which typically feature a white base with a pink or red upper lip. Native to rocky and arid environments in southern Europe, this plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are erect and often branched. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and adaptability to harsh conditions.
